title: Coast Guard Flyover Shows Extensive Flooding Along North Carolina Coast
text:
Streets and houses were flooded along the North Carolina coast on Friday, September 6, after Hurricane Dorian made landfall in the area earlier that day.

This footage shows a Coast Guard flyover to survey flooded areas in Avon, Elizabeth City and Cape Hatteras, where the National Weather Service said the hurricane made landfall.

The National Hurricane Center said on Friday morning that floodwater on Hatteras Island, northeast of Ocracoke Island, was more than five feet high and called the situation “life-threatening.”

The Governor of North Carolina, Roy Cooper, said that authorities were working to rescue those stranded by the hurricane on Ocracoke and to restore power after outages along the coast. Credit: PO1 Stephen Lehmann via Storyful
description: Streets and houses were flooded along the North Carolina coast on Friday, September 6, after Hurricane Dorian made landfall in the area earlier that day. This footage shows a Coast Guard flyover to survey flooded areas in Avon, Elizabeth City and Cape Hatteras, where the National Weather Service said the hurricane made landfall. The National Hurricane Center said on Friday morning that floodwater on Hatteras Island, northeast of Ocracoke Island, was more than five feet high and called the situation “life-threatening.” The Governor of North Carolina, Roy Cooper, said that authorities were working to rescue those stranded by the hurricane on Ocracoke and to restore power after outages along the coast. Credit: PO1 Stephen Lehmann via Storyful
